author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State government on Tuesday informed the Madras High Court that the 72-year-old man who fell unconscious while participating in a protest, organised recently by four organisations working for disability rights, and later died in a government hospital was not a person with special needs and that he died of a natural cause. S. Manoharan, Joint Commissioner of Police, East Zone, Chennai, made the submissions to the First Bench headed by the Chief Justice S.K. Kaul, as the court took suo motu cognisance of the issue following an urgent motion moved by R.M.D. Nasrullah, an advocate, who is visually impaired, based on news reports.

The Joint Commissioner further submitted that the authorities took all the necessary steps to handle differently abled persons as per the guidelines prescribed by the High Court through an order dated September 12, 2014.

The judges then declared that the proceedings as closed.

Kuppusamy, 72-years-old, had come to assist a differently-abled person
title: Man who collapsed during stir was not disabled: govt.
